1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Infix operators.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Overture.Infix
6 ( -- * Infix operators
7   (&), (++),
8
9   -- ** Map
10   (/$/), (<++>),
11   (<?>), (<$$>),
12
13   -- ** Monad
14   (#), (#.),
15   (<#>), (<#!>),
16   (<#++>),
17 ) where
18
19import Prelude hiding ((++))
20import qualified Control.Monad
21import qualified Data.Maybe                     as May
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture.Type  as O
23
24infixr 0 &
25
26-- | Pairing operator.
27--
28--   >>> "a" & "b"
29--   ("a", "b")
30--
31--   >>> "a" & "b" & "c"
32--   ("a", ("b", "c"))
33--
34{-# INLINE (&) #-}
35(&) :: a -> b -> (a, b)
36a & b = (a, b)
37
38infixr 6 ++
39
40-- | Associative operator of monoid,
41--   same as 'mappend' or infix '<>'.
42--
43--   >>> Just "abc" ++ Nothing ++ Just "def"
44--   Just "abcdef"
45--
46{-# INLINE (++) #-}
47(++) :: (Monoid a) => a -> a -> a
48(++) = mappend
49
50
51-- ----------------------  Map
52
53-- | Apply function to reversed list, and reverse back.
54--
55--   >>> take 3 $ "abcdefg"
56--   "abc"
57--
58--   >>> take 3 /$/ "abcdefg"
59--   "efg"
60--
61(/$/) :: O.Map [a] -> O.Map [a]
62(/$/) f = reverse . f . reverse
63
64-- | Same as 'concatMap'.
65--
66--   >>> words <++> ["foo bar", "baz quux"]
67--   ["foo","bar","baz","quux"]
68--
69{-# INLINE (<++>) #-}
70(<++>) :: (a -> [b]) -> [a] -> [b]
71(<++>) = concatMap
72
73-- | Same as 'May.mapMaybe'.
74(<?>) :: (a -> Maybe b) -> [a] -> [b]
75(<?>) = May.mapMaybe
76
77infixl 4 <$$>
78
79-- | Double fmap.
80--
81--   >>> length <$$> [("a", "apple"), ("b", "banana"), ("c", "cocoa")]
82--   [("a",5), ("b",6), ("c",5)]
83--
84(<$$>) :: (Functor f, Functor g) => (a -> b) -> f (g a) -> f (g b)
85f <$$> x = fmap f <$> x
86
87
88-- ----------------------  Monad
89
90infixr 1 #
91
92-- | Monadic application, same as '=<<'.
93(#) :: (Monad m) => (a -> m b) -> m a -> m b
94(#) = (=<<)
95
96infixr 1 #.
97
98-- | Composition of monadic functions, same as 'Control.Monad.<=<'.
99(#.) :: (Monad m) => (b -> m c) -> (a -> m b) -> a -> m c
100(#.) = (Control.Monad.<=<)
101
102-- | Monadic mapping, same as 'mapM'.
103{-# INLINE (<#>) #-}
104(<#>) :: (Monad m, Traversable t) => (a -> m b) -> t a -> m (t b)
105(<#>) = mapM
106
107-- | Execution by monadic mapping, same as 'mapM_'.
108{-# INLINE (<#!>) #-}
109(<#!>) :: (Monad m, Traversable t) => (a -> m b) -> t a -> m ()
110(<#!>) = mapM_
111
112-- | Monadic concat mappping.
113(<#++>) :: (Monad m) => (a -> m [b]) -> [a] -> m [b]
114(<#++>) f a = (return . concat) # (f <#> a)
